text: I knew I recognized this band's sound from somewhere... It took me until track 6 on the soundtrack to nail it down; this is where the music used in 2 Player Productions' Double Fine Adventure documentary comes from.

text: I totally agree with that statement.  I really enjoyed the soundtrack for this game.  It has an organic feel that i really enjoy and most of the songs are atmospheric and nice to listen to.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. @SupraDarky How is this song even remotely "Organic" (has an organic feel: organic sound)??  This song sounds like it is for a super high-tech machine technology-esque place.

text: One of my favorite soundtracks for a game.
author: GNARK1LL420

text: The game never was discounted during the recent sale, maybe Christmas will be a different story...
author: Sephiko

text: Yeah, the soundtrack was definitely this game's highlight. Lifeformed is a very underrated composer, we really don't hear too much about him or upcoming games featuring his music, unfortunately. Very nice synthy and organic sound with the right amount of reverb.
author: SupraDarky

text: Some of his music's in a recent rhythm-based, bullet-hell-esque game called Soundodger, both the music and the game are pretty neat! I also agree, I love every single song from this soundtrack, which is a rarity.
author: Chrys Terious

text: Apparently he was also one of the game designers of Dustforce, I wonder if his team is working on any new titles as well...
author: xSayPleasex

text: @xSayPleasex Hitbox's current major project is called Spire (not to be confused with the already existing game The Spire).  There isn't a huge amount of information about it, but the design philosophy is that it's going to be an FPS rogue-like with Dustforce-esque movement (I believe I recall reading somewhere that it's somewhat inspired by Quake 3's style of quick movement).
author: AND4H
